intro: Adenocarpus intermedius proles complicatus, commonly known as the complex-leaf burr grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces burrs that aid in seed dispersal. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and ecological role in its native habitats.
